attributes.action: Make travel companies refund the total cost of a package holiday due to COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: We, like many others, booked our holiday for 2020 before COVID-19 was around. We were due to go in mid-August but the FCO advised against all but essential travel to a number of counties including Spain. On The Beach have stated that if the flight goes ahead we cannot get any money back. We booked the holiday as a package and I don’t believe it’s fair to penalise customers where they have no choice in what carrier they use
attributes.background: Get companies like On The Beach to refund customers in full for holidays affected by COVID-19 rather than use their T & C’s as a get out clause.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

rejection.details:
It’s about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for.

Arrangements for refunding, changing or rebooking travel are a civil matter between individual travellers and holiday operators, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Require travel companies & airlines to pay compensation if no refund in 14 days: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317878

Create a fund to reimburse money lost due to covid-19 travel: cancellations: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304912

Require airlines cancel flights to places the FCO has advised against travel to: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333773
